meanings.definition: Having the ability to retain or remember information.
meanings.sent1: She is very retentive when it comes to memorizing facts for her exams.
meanings.sent2: His retentive memory helps him recall important details easily.
meanings.sent3: The retentive student never forgets to bring her homework to school.
meanings.sent4: Her mind is like a retentive sponge, soaking up knowledge effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The retentive nature of his brain makes learning new things a breeze.

meanings.definition: Tending to retain or hold onto something.
meanings.sent1: The retentive child clung tightly to his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: She has a retentive grip on the handle of the suitcase.
meanings.sent3: The retentive puppy refused to let go of the ball during playtime.
meanings.sent4: His retentive nature with memories makes him cherish every moment.
meanings.sent5: The retentive nature of the soil kept the water from draining away too quickly.

meanings.definition: Capable of retaining moisture or other substances.
meanings.sent1: The retentive soil in the garden helps plants stay hydrated.
meanings.sent2: The retentive fabric of the towel quickly absorbs any spills.
meanings.sent3: The retentive sponge soaked up all the excess water in the sink.
meanings.sent4: Her retentive skin retained the moisturizer, keeping it soft all day.
meanings.sent5: The retentive nature of the paper prevented ink from smudging.
